quest.name: Bait and Swat
journal: Anaoc deems a confrontation with the kobolds imminent.

The kobolds and Lominsans have long shared an armistice, but Anaoc is convinced that the peace is untenable, and that recent kobold incursions justify a preemptive attack. Arenlona of the Dawn Meadow will brief you on the stratagem.
Arenlona posits that, since prolonged famine has driven the kobolds to raid the Stead for foodstuffs, they can be baited out. Speak to Anaoc about preparing the lure.
Anaoc directs you to Skarnmhar, who can supply you with dodo meat from an unshipped consignment.
K'wabati waits by the southern mouth of Blind Iron Mines to instruct you where to set the crate of meat.
Set the crate of meat in the mines.
Slay the kobolds that take the bait.
Inform Anaoc that the mines are clear of kobolds.

The immediate threat has been quelled, but the specter of a kobold uprising still looms. Speak with Baderon at the Drowning Wench to see what can be done to fortify the Red Rooster Stead for the trials ahead.

Baderon recognizes that, in their zeal to summon Titan, the kobolds have been amassing crystals through increasingly violent means. He will speak with the Yellowjackets about a dispatch to defend the Red Rooster Stead, but it will matter little should Titan awaken.
objectives: Speak with K'wabati at Blind Iron Mines.
Set the crate of meat in the mines.
Take cover and ambush the kobolds that appear.
Speak with Baderon at the Drowning Wench.

dialogue.name: ANAOC
dialogue.text: You've seen with your own eyes how the kobolds have taken up arms against us.

dialogue.name: ANAOC
dialogue.text: The mines of O'Ghomoro aren't enough for the native nuisances of northern Vylbrand anymore. They've come to claim what is ours.

dialogue.name: ANAOC
dialogue.text: Long ago, our war-weary forebears struck a shortsighted peace with the kobolds: what lay beneath the sea was to be Limsa's, what lay underground was O'Ghomoro's.

dialogue.name: ANAOC
dialogue.text: Yet what resolved one conflict created another, as the sea cannot fully feed, clothe, and shelter the children of land. Realizing this, the kobolds tacitly condoned the Lominsan settlement of La Noscea. We shared an unspoken agreement.

dialogue.name: ANAOC
dialogue.text: But now, the kobolds aggressively assert their dominion, threatening our very survival.

dialogue.name: ANAOC
dialogue.text: Adherence to a pact is meaningless if it means our demise. It comes time for us to take a stand. Seek the wisdom of Arenlona to learn how.

dialogue.name: ARENLONA
dialogue.text: So, Anaoc has at last abandoned the naive hope that the kobold menace would abate of its own accord.

dialogue.name: ARENLONA
dialogue.text: Their numbers have increased manifold as they expand southward. The food shortages spurred by overpopulation quicken the cycle of aggression.

dialogue.name: ARENLONA
dialogue.text: A common beggar would know better than to expect foodstuffs aboard a stagecoach bound for the Stead, but the filthy scamps grow desperate.

dialogue.name: ARENLONA
dialogue.text: We need only set the bait, and their hunger will be their undoing. Tell Anaoc to make the arrangements.

dialogue.name: ANAOC
dialogue.text: Ingenious. We'll trap the hungry kobolds as one would any rodent.

dialogue.name: ANAOC
dialogue.text: And I know just the bait to set. Tell Skarnmhar to set aside some dodo meat from our next shipment.

dialogue.name: ANAOC
dialogue.text: Set a bit of that in Blind Iron Mines and the little gluttons won't be able to resist.

dialogue.name: SKARNMHAR
dialogue.text: I hand dead dodo to you, and you kill kobolds for me? A bargain if I ever heard one!

dialogue.name: SKARNMHAR
dialogue.text: Take this over to K'wabati south of the mines. She'll know where it goes.

dialogue.name: KWABATI
dialogue.text: Good to see the Red Rooster Stead hasn't turned chicken on us.

dialogue.name: KWABATI
dialogue.text: Once you've found a good hiding spot, open the crate of meat nearby. The kobolds will follow their noses; by the time they see you, it'll be too late.

dialogue.name: ANAOC
dialogue.text: Haha, you've done it! I expected no less.

dialogue.name: ANAOC
dialogue.text: I don't know what we'd have done without you...which makes me wonder what we will do once you've gone.

dialogue.name: ANAOC
dialogue.text: I was hoping you might visit the Drowning Wench and speak with Baderon.

dialogue.name: ANAOC
dialogue.text: It is no secret the Yellowjackets pay him heed. Mayhap he would put in a word, so that the Stead might procure their protection.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: So the Stead's in over their 'eads with the kobolds, are they?

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: 'Twas wishful thinkin' to believe the mine rats would stay put in O'Ghomoro.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Any barkeep can tell ye as rodents're wont to spread. This wave just comes sooner than reckoned.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: The pact was a farceâ”€no 'andshake ever solved a blood feud. We just needed to lick our wounds a while is all.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Well, I s'pose they're all 'ealed up. Even the Maelstrom's taken note of 'ow the rascals run rampant.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Ye can be sure they're 'oardin' crystals to summon Titan, an' gods 'elp us if they do.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Limsa'll look back on these petty thefts an' skirmishes as the good ol' times when that day comes, I tell ye!

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: An' there won't be a Company of 'Eroes around to answer our prayers this time, neither!

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Well, an onze o' prevention's worth a ponze o' cure. I'll talk to the Yellowjackets an' see if they can't slow the kobolds' advance on the Stead.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!
